Module ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes

Class Circle

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Shape
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Oval
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Circle
public class Circle extends Oval
A class representing a circle on the canvas.

The Circle class extends the Oval class and overrides certain behaviors to ensure that the shape is a perfect circle, defined by a radius derived from the distance between its center and an endpoint.

Note: This class relies on a potentially problematic interpretation of radius and center, as it does not account for the possibility that the start and end points might yield an ellipse. Ensure only appropriate use where true circular behavior is expected.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Circle

      public Circle(Point centre, Point end, PaintProperties pp)
      Creates a new Circle with the specified center and endpoint, along with its paint properties.
      Parameters:
      centre - The center point of the circle.
      end - The endpoint used to determine the radius.
      pp - Paint properties that specify the appearance of the circle.

  • Method Details

    • getPaintInfo

      public double[] getPaintInfo()
      Returns an array containing the coordinates and dimensions necessary to paint this circle on the canvas. The method calculates the radius as the Euclidean distance between the center and endpoint, ensuring the shape maintains a circular form.
      Overrides:
      getPaintInfo in class Oval
      Returns:
      A double array where the elements represent: - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounding box - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounding box - The width of the bounding box (diameter of the circle) - The height of the bounding box (equal to the width for a circle)
